src.land
Interface Land

All Known Implementing Classes:
Exit, Obstruction, Shop, Street, Water
public interface Land

An interface that has functions to make it easy for other parts of the code to perform checks on and modify the land. Outside, Shop, Street and Wall are clases that implement the Land class.

Author:
Darren Watts date 11/11/07

Method Detail

getLandType

int getLandType()
Returns the type of the land object. Must be implemented in subclasses.

Returns:
LandType : type of the land object.

canEnter

boolean canEnter()
This method is implemented in subclases and will return true if the land object allows for the player to enter it.

Returns:
Boolean indicating whether or not the player can enter the object.

enter

void enter(Player plr)
           throws PlayerEnteredException,
                  EnemyDiedException
The player attemps to enter this land object. If possible, the player will enter successfully. If not, an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
plr - Player : the player trying to enter the land object.
Throws:
PlayerEnteredException
EnemyDiedException

enter

boolean enter(Enemy enemy)
An enemy attemps to enter this land object. Will return true if the enemy successfully moved.

Parameters:
enemy - The enemy that's moving into the land object.
Returns:
boolean : successfully entered

getImage

java.lang.String getImage()
Gets the image file name.

Returns:
Image file name as a String.

getLandImage

java.lang.String getLandImage()
Gets the image file name of the land object. This will return the picture of the ground, instead of any object that is sitting on the land.

Returns:
String : image file name.

hasPlayer

int hasPlayer()
This method reports if there is a player on this object.

Returns:
int : index of the player at this land object. If there is not player, it will return -1.

addEnemy

void addEnemy(Enemy enemy)
Adds an enemy to this object. Only valid if it's a street.

Parameters:
enemy - The enemy to add.

addItem

void addItem(Item item)
Adds an item to this object. Only valid if it's a street.

Parameters:
item - The item to add.

getEnemy

Enemy getEnemy()
Returns the enemy. If no enemy exists, returns null.

Returns:
Enemy in this land object.

getItem

Item getItem()
Returns the item. If no item exists, returns null.

Returns:
Item in this land object.

hasBeenExplored

boolean hasBeenExplored()
Keeps track of whether the land object has been explored or not. This is used for the overhead map.

Returns:
Boolean
